svg.text: OWASP RISK MAPPING — MASO CONTROL COVERAGE
LLM TOP 10 (2025) + AGENTIC TOP 10 (2026) → MASO CONTROLS & PACE PHASES

g.text: → Input guardrails · Agent isolation · Goal integrity checks
→ Output filtering · DLP integration · Cross-agent data fencing
→ Model provenance · AIBOM · Signed tool manifests
→ RAG integrity checks · Training data validation · Context fencing
→ Output validation layer · LLM-as-Judge review · Sanitisation
→ Least privilege · Scoped tool access · PACE containment
→ Prompt isolation · Agent-specific system boundaries · Obfuscation
→ RAG access controls · Embedding integrity · Source validation
→ Cross-agent validation · Fact-checking agent · Confidence scoring
→ Rate limiting · Cost caps · Per-agent resource quotas
→ Goal integrity monitor · Prompt boundary enforcement · LLM01 overlap
→ Signed tool manifests · Argument validation · Sandbox execution
→ Per-agent NHI · Scoped short-lived creds · Zero-trust inter-agent
→ MCP server vetting · A2A trust chain · Runtime component signing
→ Code sandbox · Execution allow-lists · Output containment
→ Memory integrity checks · Context window fencing · Session isolation
→ Signed message bus · Mutual auth · Schema validation
→ Blast radius caps · Circuit breakers · PACE escalation
→ Confidence calibration · Decision audit · Override protocols
→ Behavioural drift detection · Kill switch · Isolated audit

svg.text: PACE PHASE ACTIVATION PER RISK SEVERITY
EU AI Act (Art. 9, 14, 15) · NIST AI RMF (Govern, Map, Measure, Manage) · ISO 42001 (§8.1-8.6) · MITRE ATLAS · DORA (Art. 11) · APRA CPS 234
Mapped from parent: Enterprise AI Security Controls Framework — github.com/JonathanCGill/enterprise-ai-security-controls-framework
MASO Framework v1.0 · Multi-Agent Security Operations · Jonathan Gill · February 2026
